item.title: Extending My OOP Understanding
item.description: There is always more to learn, especially if that focus is on programming.
item.dc:creator: Caidan Williams

item.title: The Four Pillars of Object-Orientated Programming
item.description: For a programming language to be properly considered as OOP, it must contain these four main concepts.
item.dc:creator: Caidan Williams

item.title: Programming Paradigms
item.description: The basic paradigms are imperative programming, functional programming, and object-orientated programming.
item.dc:creator: Caidan Williams

item.title: Organizing Naming Rules & Conventions
item.description: When we write code, we must be conscious of our naming conventions, as they hold a lot of meaning and will be seen by others.
item.dc:creator: Caidan Williams

item.title: The Start of a Journey
item.description:
Hello, friend.

This is a start, one which will help shape the next portion of my life. The purpose of this blog is more of a digital notebook to keep track of my progress, so I may reflect later upon this and see my improvement. I will be tracking my â€¦
item.dc:creator: Caidan Williams
